bio.singa.mathematics.vectors

Class Vectors

  • java.lang.Object
    • bio.singa.mathematics.vectors.Vectors

  • public class Vectors
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains only static utility methods to create and handle different Vectors.

      • generateRandom2DVector

        public static Vector2D generateRandom2DVector(Rectangle rectangle)
        Generates a random Vector2D that is contained in the given Rectangle. The random values is inclusive the left and bottom boundary and exclusive the right and top boundary.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - The rectangle in which the vectors should be included.
        Returns:
        A randomly placed vector.

        public static double getAverage(Vector vector)

        Returns:

      • getMedian

        public static double getMedian(Vector vector)
        Returns the median value for a given Vector. That is the middle element if vector size is odd and the average of the two middle elements of vector is even.
        Parameters:
        vector - The Vector that holds the values.
        Returns:
        The median value of all Vector elements.

      • getCentroid

        public static <VectorType extends Vector> Vector getCentroid(java.util.Collection<VectorType> vectors)
        Computes the centroid of all vectors in the collection by summing them and dividing by the number of vectors in the collection.
        Parameters:
        vectors - The vectors to calculate the centroid from.
        Returns:
        The centroid.

      • orthonormalizeVectors

        public static java.util.List<Vector> orthonormalizeVectors(java.util.List<Vector> vectors)
        This method creates an orthonormalized set of vectors in an inner product space, in this case the Euclidean space R^n equipped with the standard inner product (Vector.dotProduct(Vector)). The Gram-Schmidt process takes a finite, linearly independent list S = {v1, ..., vk} for k ≤ n and generates an orthogonal list S′ = {u1, ..., uk} that spans the same k-dimensional subspace of R^n as S.
        Parameters:
        vectors - The original vectors to be orthonormalized.
        Returns:
        A list of orthonormal vectors.
        See Also:
        Wikipedia: Gram-Schmidt process

      • gramSchmidtProjection

        public static Vector gramSchmidtProjection(Vector first,
                                           Vector second)
        The projection for the Graham-Schmidt process. This operator projects the first vector (v) orthogonally onto the line spanned by the second vector (u). If u is the zero vector the projection will be also the zero vector. The projection is calculated by:

        proj(u,v) = ((v . u) / (u . u)) * u

        with ( . ) denoting the inner product (generally the dot product)

        Parameters:
        first - The vector (v) to be projected.
        second - The vector (u) to project with.
        Returns:
        The projected vector.

      • accumulateGramSchmidtProjection

        public static Vector accumulateGramSchmidtProjection(Vector vector,
                                                     java.util.List<Vector> orthogonalizedVectors)
        Accumulates the Graham-Schmidt projection for each vector in the given list of Vectors. This orthonormalizes the vector to every vector and increases the numerical stability of the orthonormalization.
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to be projected.
        orthogonalizedVectors - The vectors to project with.
        Returns:
        The projected vector.
